description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The goal of this follow-on implementing mechanism (IM) is to strengthen the human and organizational capacity of local institutions in the field of adult and pediatric emergency medicine, OB-GYN residency program, and biomedical engineering and technology as important components for health systems strengthening. The objectives of include the following activities: 1) Continue twinning partnerships Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. objectives

The goal of this follow-on implementing mechanism (IM) is to strengthen the human and organizational capacity of local institutions in the field of adult and pediatric emergency medicine, OB-GYN residency program, and biomedical engineering and technology as important components for health systems strengthening. The objectives of include the following activities: 1) Continue twinning partnerships with medical and/or health science universities abroad to build local institutional capacity 2)Mobilize highly skilled Diaspora and in-country professionals to join the pool of faculty for the New Medical Education Initiative (NMEI) to strengthen the capacity of numerous new medical institutions to deliver high quality pre- and in-service medical and health science education. Work both nationally and regionally to target medical schools, healthcare service providers, and pre-service medical and health science education graduates. Note this IM includes a Green Light Incentive Fund proposal for the biomedical engineering portion of the IM, which has been included as a Supplemental Document. The Incentive Fund would provide $250,000; GE, the private sector partner, would contribute $450,000 in-kind These are core PEPFAR activities that directly contribute to saving lives and preventing new infections. This follow-on IM’s program supports the goals of the GOE's National Strategic Plan II (SPMII) and is closely aligns with the goals of USG HIV/AIDS Partnership Framework and Global Health Initiative. This follow-on IM will monitor each individual partner through their own established work and M&E plan, will track outcomes across partnerships working in similar technical areas, and will conduct regular evaluations measuring the overall outcomes related to its goal.

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
